fields.name: Programming Language
fields.description: Indicates whether the frameworkÆs programming language is wellknown by the team.
fields.where_to_find: Discuss with the team and consult skill sets.
fields.measurement: Very familiar: 1, Moderately familiar: 0.5, Not familiar: 0

fields.name: Maturity
fields.description: Indicates whether the technology is well-established or something new that is still being tested.
fields.where_to_find: Review the history of the framework and the community backing it.
fields.measurement: Well-established: 1, In development: 0.5, New or under testing: 0

fields.name: Code Generators and Scaffolding
fields.description: Tools that allow developers to rapidly generate code for common components such as models, views, and controllers.
fields.where_to_find: Consult the frameworkÆs documentation and available tools.
fields.measurement: Extensive support and efficiency: 1, Moderate support: 0.5, No support or inefficient: 0

fields.name: Documentation Quality
fields.description: Availability and completeness of official documentation.
fields.where_to_find: Official website or GitHub repository
fields.measurement: well-organized documentation: 1, Some useful documentation: 0.5, Poor or non-existent: 0

fields.name: Community Support
fields.description: Availability of community resources, tutorials, and forums.
fields.where_to_find: Online communities, Stack Overflow, GitHub.
fields.measurement: Strong community: 1, Moderate community: 0.5, Limited or no community: 0

fields.name: Learning Curve
fields.description: Time and effort required to become proficient
fields.where_to_find: Personal experience, online tutorials, and courses
fields.measurement: Easy to learn : 1, Moderate learning: 0.5, Steep learning: 0

fields.name: Authentication
fields.description: Support for standard authentication protocols like OAuth, JWT.
fields.where_to_find: Check the framework documentation or built-in features.
fields.measurement: Multiple authentication protocols: 1,  One authentication protocol: 0.5, No authentication: 0

fields.name: Authorization
fields.description: Ease of implementing access controls at a resource level.
fields.where_to_find: Framework documentation and user reviews.
fields.measurement: Flexible authorization features: 1,  Basic authorization features: 0.5, no authorization features: 0

fields.name: Attack Mitigation
fields.description: Resistance to common attacks like SQL Injection, XSS, CSRF
fields.where_to_find: Security audit reports and framework documentation
fields.measurement: (Resistant to multiple attacks: 1, Resistant to at least one attack: 0.5, No resistance: 0

fields.name: Encryption
fields.description: Support for encrypting data in transit and at rest.
fields.where_to_find: Framework documentation.
fields.measurement: Support both Data-in-transit and data-at-rest encryption: 1, Supports either: 0.5, No support: 0

fields.name: Auditing and Logging
fields.description: Ability to perform detailed tracking of security-related activities.
fields.where_to_find: Framework features or third-party integrations
fields.measurement: Detailed: 1, Basic logging capabilities: 0.5, No security logging and auditing: 0

fields.name: Reported security issues
fields.description: Indicates the frameworkÆs vulnerability and security robustness. Number of reported security issues in the past year.
fields.where_to_find: Security advisory databases, frameworkÆs official channels.
fields.measurement: Few or no reported issues (0-3): 1, Moderate number of issues (4-7): 0.5, Many issues (>7): 0

fields.name: Horizontal Scalability
fields.description: The ability of the framework to handle more requests by adding more machines in the pool.
fields.where_to_find: Through stress tests and framework documentation.
fields.measurement: Easily scales horizontally: 1, Horizontal scaling but manual configuration: 0.5, Not support: 0

fields.name: Vertical Scalability
fields.description: The ability to handle more requests by adding more power (CPU, RAM) to an existing machine.
fields.where_to_find: Through performance tests and documentation.
fields.measurement: Easily scales vertically: 1, Vertical scaling but application changes: 0.5, Not support: 0

fields.name: Load Balancing
fields.description: The ability to distribute incoming network traffic across multiple servers.
fields.where_to_find: Framework documentation and feature set.
fields.measurement: Built-in load balancing: 1, Manually config for load balancing: 0.5, No load balancing support: 0

fields.name: Microservices Architecture Support
fields.description: Capability to break up the application into loosely coupled, independently deployable components.
fields.where_to_find: Framework features, documentation, and community support.
fields.measurement: Full support: 1, Some support: 0.5, No support: 0

fields.name: State Management
fields.description: Ability to manage user sessions and data across multiple servers.
fields.where_to_find: Framework documentation or third-party libraries.
fields.measurement: Built-in state management: 1, Can handle state: 0.5, No state management: 0

fields.name: Latency
fields.description: The time it takes for the framework to respond to a single request.
fields.where_to_find: This can be found using monitoring tools, load testing, benchmarks, official documentation.
fields.measurement: Less than 100 ms: 1, Between 100 ms and 300 ms: 0.5, More than 300 ms: 0

fields.name: Throughput
fields.description: The number of requests that the system can handle per second.
fields.where_to_find: Measured through load testing and performance monitoring, benchmarks, official documentation.
fields.measurement: More than 1000 requests: 1,  Between 500 and 1000 requests: 0.5, Less than 500 requests: 0

fields.name: CPU Usage
fields.description: Percentage of CPU time required for operations.
fields.where_to_find: Using system resource monitoring tools, benchmarks.
fields.measurement: CPU usage less than 60%: 1, CPU usage between 60% and 80%: 0.5, CPU usage above 80%: 0

fields.name: Memory Usage
fields.description: Amount of RAM used during operations.
fields.where_to_find: Through system resource monitoring or profiling tools, benchmarks.
fields.measurement: Memory usage less than 70%: 1, Memory usage between 70% and 85%: 0.5, Memory usage above 85%: 0

fields.name: Number of stars/forks on platforms like GitHub
fields.description: Indicates community trust and engagement.
fields.where_to_find: FrameworkÆs GitHub or similar repositories.
fields.measurement: Many stars/forks (>20k): 1, Moderate stars/forks (10k-20k): 0.5, Few stars/forks (<10k): 0

fields.name: Community activity and responsiveness
fields.description: Gauge of community support.
fields.where_to_find: Forums, Stack Overflow, and GitHub issues.
fields.measurement: Very active and responsive: 1, Moderately active: 0.5, Barely active or unresponsive: 0

fields.name: Cross-Platform Support
fields.description: Ability to run the application on multiple platforms without major code modifications.
fields.where_to_find: Official documentation and developer community forums.
fields.measurement: Multiple platforms: 1, Multiple platforms but with code modifications: 0.5, Not cross-platform: 0

fields.name: Containerization Support
fields.description: Ease of packaging the application and its dependencies into a container.
fields.where_to_find: Framework documentation and community discussions.
fields.measurement: Native containerization: 1,Containerization but with configuration: 0.5, Not containerization: 0

fields.name: Cloud Compatibility
fields.description: How well the framework integrates with cloud services.
fields.where_to_find: Framework documentation, cloud service documentation, and developer testimonials.
fields.measurement: Excellent compatibility: 1, Some compatibility: 0.5, Poor or no cloud compatibility: 0

fields.name: Database Agnosticism
fields.description: Flexibility to work with different types of databases.
fields.where_to_find: Framework documentation and feature set.
fields.measurement: Multiple types of databases: 1, Limited to certain types: 0.5, Specific database: 0

fields.name: Code Complexity
fields.description: The ease with which the codebase can be understood, modified, and extended.
fields.where_to_find: Code analysis tools, code reviews.
fields.measurement: Low complexity: 1, Moderate complexity: 0.5, High complexity: 0

fields.name: Modularity
fields.description: The extent to which the application is divided into independent, interchangeable modules.
fields.where_to_find: Codebase structure, framework documentation.
fields.measurement: Highly modular design: 1, Some modularity: 0.5, Monolithic design, low modularity: 0

fields.name: Testability
fields.description: How conducive the framework is to unit testing, integration testing, and end-to-end testing.
fields.where_to_find: Framework documentation, community forums, codebase.
fields.measurement: Framework provides testing tools: 1, Testing possible: 0.5, Poorly suited for testing: 0

fields.name: Long-Term Support
fields.description: Availability of long-term support for the framework, including security updates and bug fixes.
fields.where_to_find: Official announcements, framework website, community forums.
fields.measurement: Guaranteed long-term support: 1, Some level of support: 0.5, No long-term support:0

fields.name: Licensing
fields.description: Cost associated with the frameworkÆs license, if applicable.
fields.where_to_find: Official framework website, documentation, or pricing page.
fields.measurement: No licensing cost: 1, Moderate licensing cost: 0.5,  High licensing cost: 0

fields.name: Server Resources
fields.description: Requirements and costs associated with CPU, memory, and storage.
fields.where_to_find: Framework documentation, case studies, real-world usage.
fields.measurement: Minimal requirements and low cost: 1, Moderate requirements: 0.5, High requirements: 0)

fields.name: Migration Cost
fields.description: Time and resources required to migrate from another system.
fields.where_to_find: Developer testimonials, documentation, community forums.
fields.measurement: Easy and low-cost migration: 1, Moderate in terms of time:0.5, Difficult and costly to migrate: 0

fields.name: Learning Cost
fields.description: Time required for the team to get up to speed with the framework.
fields.where_to_find: Community forums, developer feedback, personal experience
fields.measurement: Quick learning curve: 1, Moderate time to learn: 0.5, Steep learning curve:0

fields.name: Libraries and Tools
fields.description: Ease of integrating external libraries and third-party tools.
fields.where_to_find: Framework documentation, developer communities, and tutorials.
fields.measurement: Very easy to integrate: 1, Moderately easy to integrate: 0.5, Difficult to integrate: 0

fields.name: Frontend Compatibility
fields.description: Ease of integration with frontend frameworks and libraries.
fields.where_to_find: Framework documentation, community forums, and example projects.
fields.measurement: Very easy to integrate: 1, Moderately easy to integrate: 0.5, Difficult to integrate: 0

fields.name: APIs and Connectivity
fields.description: Ease of connecting to external services via APIs.
fields.where_to_find: Framework documentation, API documentation of external services, developer testimonials.
fields.measurement: Very easy to connect: 1, Moderately easy to connect: 0.5, Difficult to connect: 0

fields.name: Updates and Maintenance
fields.description: Frequency and quality of updates to the framework.
fields.where_to_find: Framework release notes, community forums, and feedback.
fields.measurement: Frequent-high-quality : 1, Infrequent-medium-quality : 0.5, Rare-poor-quality : 0
